Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. Jacques Andre DeGraff, Associate Pastor, Canaan Baptist Church, 132 W. 116th St. N.Y. 10026.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Perkins.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Dr. Jacques Andre DeGraff, Associate Pastor, Canaan Baptist Church, 132 W.116th Street, New York, N.Y. 10026.

Council Member Perkins moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 31, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Cabrera.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Cabrera, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of October 31, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Anne Holford-Smith to the Council for its advice and consent in anticipation of her appointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Anne Holford-Smith,  Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Alameda Sky Chapman, Candidate for recommendation by the Council to the Youth Board, pursuant to ยง 734 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Alameda Sky Chapman, Youth Board

Items.Title: Communication from the Board of Elections - Submitting the Certifications of the Members of the City Council.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Certifications of the Members of the City Council.

Items.Title: Communication from the New York County Democratic Committee recommending the name of Sylvia Di Pietro to the Council regarding her appointment to the office of Commissioner of Elections of the Board of Elections pursuant to ยง 3-204 of the New York State Election Law.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Sylvia Di Pietr, Office of Commissioner of Elections of the Board of Elections

Items.Title: Resolution to observe every May 25th as Kalief Browder Day in the City of New York.

Items.MatterName: Observe every May 25th as Kalief Browder Day in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of citywide administrative services to notify the department of education and the school construction authority when city-owned or leased property of an adequate size is determined to have no current use
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring DCAS to notify the DOE and the school construction authority when city-owned or leased property of an adequate size is determined to have no current use.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to post subdistrict maps online
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to post subdistrict maps online.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on United States Attorney General Jeff Sessions and the United States Department of Justice to consider the importance of independent programming on TV, such as Televisiฯn Dominicana, as the AT&T/ Time Warner merger is reviewed.

Items.MatterName: US Attorney General Jeff Sessions and the US Dept of Justice to consider the importance of independent programming on TV, such as Televisiฯn Dominicana, as the AT&T/ Time Warner merger is reviewed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the city to remove snow from sidewalks when abutting landowners fail to do so and plow sidewalks after four inches of snow accumulate

Items.MatterName: Requiring the city to remove snow from sidewalks when abutting landowners fail to do so and plow sidewalks after four inches of snow accumulate.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to post methodology and data for determining identified seat need.

Items.Title: Resolution to support New York City's application for funding for a capital project under the Restore New York Communities Initiative pursuant to the New York State Urban Development Act, for Station Plaza, in the borough of Queens.

Items.MatterName: Support NYC's application for funding for a capital project under the Restore NY Communities Initiative pursuant to the NYS Urban Development Act, for Station Plaza, Queens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of community notification by the department of city planning upon receipt of a completed pre-application statement.

Items.MatterName: Allow NYC to provide a credit against the business corporation and unincorporated business taxes to fleet companies for a portion of the qualifying expenses on safety technology systems.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Tuesday, December 19, 2017.


MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY 
City Clerk, Clerk of the Council
